result.execSummary:
All charges against Sylvester Nickelson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sylvester Nickelson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sylvester Nickelson

records.addlTxt: Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Sylvester Nickelson not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Sylvester Nickelson not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs on behalf of Gerald Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pretrial conference. Court conducts final pretrial conference with counsel off the record.  Court places status on the record. Case remains calendared for SPEEDY jury trial on 4/18/2022 at 9:00 am in Br. 35.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Sylvester Nickelson not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan on behalf of Gerald Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with *M.C.M
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sylvester Nickelson in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Sylvester Nickelson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sylvester Nickelson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sylvester Nickelson

Prior: 3024 North 6th Street, Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
